title: Notation for nonempty intersection
snippet: There is no standard mathematical symbol for the intersection relation. You've probably encountered the symbol for the intersection *operation*. If A and B are sets, then A \cap B is "the intersection" of A and B, i.e., the set of all x such that x \in A and x \in B. It's the middle part of a Venn diagram. That's all well and good, but I'm talking about the intersection *relation*. We say that A "intersects" B if there *exists* some x such that x \in A and x \in B.
